articles.title: Live FTSE jumps as markets reopen – live updates - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Britain's growth will outstrip that of the US and Europe next year, the International Monetary Fund has predicted, as vaccine rollouts and huge stimulus efforts power global growth.
articles.content: Good morning. The FTSE 100 is tipped to open higher after Wall Street hit new highs yesterday. The S&P 500 index rose 1.4pc to end at a record 4,078, boosted by positive economic data in the US.… [+1392 chars]

articles.title: COVID-19: Head of European Medicines Agency says it is 'increasingly difficult' to say no link between Oxford jab and rare blood clots - Sky News
articles.description: The UK regulator has maintained there is no evidence of a causal link between blood clots and the Oxford jab.

articles.title: Australia short of 3 million AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses in blow to inoculation drive - CNA
articles.description: SYDNEY: Australia on Tuesday (Apr 6) said it had not yet received more than 3 million doses of previously promised AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses amid export curbs by the European Union, leaving a major hole in its early nationwide inoculation drive.

articles.title: Rúaidhrí O'Connor: 'Munster at an all-too-familiar crossroads and it's time to line up O'Gara's return' - Independent.ie
